Well one of my main problem is like all other courses, is in the end you have to be genius to be able navigate thru all of the application like Buffer, Google Trends , Busssumo, Spyfu, Similarweb, and the list goes on and who has time to study and comprehend them all  . My other concern is that they are all free until you really need them ( never free ) 14 days free trial and limited access  or need to upgrade to premium . That being said there are a few interesting tip but for regular Joe like me who thought that he had found a course that would finally give him THE edge for marketing his product not even close sorry. But here is an idea why not include a sent us your .com and we will do it once so you can have head start  so here is mine utag3dvision.com  .

However, roughly a third of the relevant quiz questions and the final were about these uncovered details rather than the content itself.

Typical of the marketers of this time period.  Rehashing the same hackneyed ideas that created the platforms which preceded them.  Only the segments on "Stealing Customers" and "Shadow your Clients" reflected the actual marketing that is exclusive to the internet and making good use of the media.  There is so much more to the possibilities of the internet as a media and as an advertising platform.  In the end this course was about Advertising and not about Marketing, per se.  Marketing is tightly defining your best customers and super-serving their needs.  Some overview of how to identify your best customers' values and lifestyles provides huge clarity in meeting their expectations -- that's marketing.  This effort was generic in its spectrum.  Finally, this is not a class where learning has the chance to take place.  This is an "Exposure" to an approach in generally solving the creative question in Advertising.  In a traditional class, students are expected to memorize the correct answers in order to clearly demonstrate that they have met the expected learning outcomes.  That approach is not learning either.  That's just memorized what the teacher thinks and says.  Learning takes place through repeating the fundamentals over time, making mistakes, getting correction, and finally being able to articulate a greater understanding as a result of the training.

I enrolled in the 'Viral Marketing: 7 Secrets To Promote Any Product' course, and it exceeded all my expectations. The content is not only insightful but also presented in a clear and engaging manner. The instructor's expertise shines through, making complex concepts easy to grasp.

What I appreciated most was the practical approach. The course provided actionable strategies that I could implement immediately. It's evident that the instructor is not only knowledgeable but also passionate about the subject matter.

The course structure is well-organized, making it easy to follow, and the real-world examples added valuable context to the theories discussed. I've already seen positive results in my promotional efforts after applying the secrets shared in the course.

Overall, a definite 5-star rating! Highly recommended for anyone looking to up their viral marketing game and promote any product effectively. Thank you!

Amazing course. Super engaging.

I was hesitant to believe a course this short would have any value, but I have to say it was absolutely fantastic. The videos were brief and to the point, and although I usually don't have the patience for stories or examples once I already understand a concept, the instructor was able to balance anecdotal examples with actionable information in an effective and digestible manner. 

I appreciate all of the specific tools to use for leveraging competitor insights and audiences. I also liked how statistics were used to strengthen a point but were presented laymen's terms. 

My only complaint is with the value in relation to the price. I finished the material in under an hour and it was over $60. I have definitely watched YouTube videos with equal or more value, for free. However, I know there is value in having all of the points presented in one session rather than identifying what to search for on my own. Once I am making money with UGC, I hope I can look back and recognize that the cost was an investment in my success!

Thank you.
